title: 112_hr5833
content: The Act titled "Veterans Burial Benefits Improvement Act of 2012" increases burial benefits for veterans. The "Veterans Burial Benefits Improvement Act of 2012" increases burial and funeral expenses, plot allowance, and annual adjustments for veterans. The amendments increase burial and funeral expenses, plot allowance, and annual adjustments for veterans. The effective date applies to deaths occurring after the enactment of the Act, with exceptions for fiscal year 2012. The amendments increase burial and funeral expenses, plot allowance, and annual adjustments for veterans, including the restoration of veteran plot allowance eligibility and headstone or marker allowance. The amendment restores plot allowance eligibility for veterans of any war who were discharged for a disability incurred in the line of duty or are veterans of any war. The amendment allows for reimbursement of non-Government headstones or markers for veterans discharged for a disability incurred in the line of duty or veterans of any war. The amendment prohibits reimbursement for non-Government headstones or markers for individuals described in section 2411(b) of this title. Effective date applies to deaths occurring after the enactment of this Act. Expansion of burial benefits for veterans. Expansion of burial benefits for homeless veterans not serving during wartime, allowing the Secretary to pay funeral expenses up to a specified amount for individuals meeting the criteria of a homeless veteran. Expansion of burial benefits for homeless veterans not serving during wartime, allowing the Secretary to pay funeral expenses up to a specified amount for individuals meeting the criteria of a homeless veteran who lacks next of kin, resources for burial expenses, and served honorably in the Armed Forces. No deductions are made based on the veteran's assets or contributions towards burial. The burial benefits for homeless veterans not serving during wartime have been expanded to cover funeral expenses up to a specified amount for those meeting the criteria of a homeless veteran without next of kin or resources for burial. No deductions are made based on the veteran's assets or contributions towards burial expenses. No claim shall be allowed for expenses covered by the United States, a State, or the employer of the deceased veteran. The burial benefits for homeless veterans not serving during wartime have been expanded to cover funeral expenses up to a specified amount for those meeting the criteria of a homeless veteran without next of kin or resources for burial. Payment of expenses of funeral, transportation, and interment for the veteran is made under any other Act. The amendment expands burial benefits for homeless veterans not serving during wartime to cover funeral expenses up to a specified amount. Effective for deaths occurring after the enactment of this Act.
